Salary progression beyond this scale is subject to performanceWe are seeking to recruit a highly motivated and enthusiastic organic chemist for a Postdoctoral Research Associate/Fellow post within the EPSRC Photo-Electro Programme Grant team based in the Chemistry Building at UNUK. The project focuses on developing novel strategies for making complex molecules via multi-step processes involving light, heat and electrons. . This is a highly multidisciplinary task requiring the skills of several postdocs; specifically we are seeking a person with excellence in contemporary practical organic chemistry skills; these skills should preferably be demonstrated by your previous publication record.  The successful candidates will carry out the following duties:Undertake the development of new flow chemistry methodologies as directed by Professor Mike George.Prepare high quality supporting information for publications resulting from the project.Candidates must:Hold a PhD (or be close to completion) in synthetic organic chemistry.Be available to take up the post as soon as possible after the start of 2022.Have a proven track record of excellence in synthetic organic chemistry.Have excellent organisational, communication, and team working skills.This role is available on a fixed term basis until 31/01/2023. Hours of work are full time (36.25 hours).
